question: 25 year old immigrant with fever and several month history of cord problems. The most likely etiology of this process is: <image 1>
description: The image shows a series of five histological sections of tissue stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E). Each section appears to be from the central nervous system, likely brain tissue, given the presence of what looks like neural structures. The sections are arranged in a row, with each one showing a distinct area of tissue. The staining reveals areas of inflammation and cellular infiltration, which are characteristic of an infectious or inflammatory process. The tissue sections show varying degrees of damage and cellular response, suggesting an ongoing pathological process.
